subProducts.name: Sunflower Oil
subProducts.description: Our refined organic sunflower oil is produced from the highest quality sunflower seeds cultivated under sustainable and organic farming practices. The oil undergoes a careful hot-press extraction and multiple filtration stages, including bleaching and vacuum deodorization, to yield a clear, odorless, light-golden oil with exceptional purity. With a high smoke point and neutral taste, it is one of the most versatile edible oils suitable for frying, sautéing, baking, and salad dressings. Rich in Vitamin E, omega-6 fatty acids, and natural antioxidants, it supports heart health and promotes radiant skin. Beyond culinary use, it is highly valued in the cosmetic and pharmaceutical industries for its moisturizing and anti-inflammatory properties.

metrics.Process: Extraction of oil from the seeds, Filtering the oil on a cotton-and paper-filter, Bleaching the oil (method:filtering the oil by a filter of nonactive clay and norit), Deodorization in a vacuum kettle at a temperature of +/- 250°C. All the bad odours

features: High smoke point suitable for deep frying and high-heat applications
Naturally rich in Vitamin E and antioxidants that promote skin health
Extensive use across food, cosmetic, and pharmaceutical industries
Available in both retail and industrial bulk packaging options

subProducts.name: Palm Oil
subProducts.description: Our organic palm oil is carefully sourced and refined to meet international standards of quality, purity, and sustainability. Extracted from the fruit of the oil palm tree (Elaeis guineensis), this oil is semi-solid at room temperature, with excellent oxidative stability and a neutral taste when refined. It is a preferred choice for frying, cooking, and industrial food processing due to its resistance to rancidity and high smoke point. In addition to its extensive use in food products such as margarine, confectionery, and bakery fats, palm oil also finds significant application in cosmetics, soaps, and as a raw material in biofuel production. Our processing includes bleaching at 90–100°C and vacuum deodorization at 190–270°C to ensure optimal purity and color consistency.

metrics.Process: Crude oil is stored, then bleached at a vacuum of 90-100 °C with the help of Activated fullers earth to remove pigments and trace metals, then filtrated through a 5 micron filter, deodorised at a vacuum of 190-270 °C with added steam, to remove odour

features: Highly stable under high cooking temperatures
Sustainably sourced and certified organic
Serves as a multipurpose raw material for food, cosmetic, and energy sectors
Long shelf life and excellent resistance to oxidation

subProducts.name: Olive Oil
subProducts.description: Our cold-pressed extra virgin olive oil is crafted from handpicked organic olives sourced from Italy’s Mediterranean groves. Each batch is pressed within hours of harvest to preserve its vibrant green-golden hue, fresh grassy aroma, and naturally fruity taste with subtle peppery notes. Rich in monounsaturated fats, polyphenols, and antioxidants, this oil is ideal for dressings, marinades, drizzling, and low-heat cooking. It supports cardiovascular health and promotes anti-inflammatory benefits. The traditional mechanical cold-pressing and natural filtration methods ensure premium quality and authenticity.

metrics.Country of last processing: The organic olives are hand picked and placed in cases. After this they are processed in an olive mill. First the olives are winnowed(removal of dust, branches, leaves and heavy objects) then they are washed with cold water(removal of sand and extran

features: First cold-pressed for superior aroma and flavor retention
High in heart-healthy monounsaturated fats
Contains natural antioxidants and polyphenols
Ideal for gourmet and health-conscious consumers

subProducts.name: Sesame Oil
subProducts.description: Our organic cold-pressed sesame oil is produced from high-quality sesame seeds (Sesamum indicum) cultivated in Kenya. Extracted mechanically without the use of heat or chemicals, the oil retains its distinctive nutty aroma and rich golden color. It is a staple in Asian and Middle Eastern cuisines, used in stir-fries, marinades, sauces, and salad dressings. Sesame oil is also treasured in cosmetics, aromatherapy, and Ayurvedic medicine for its skin-conditioning, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory benefits.

metrics.Process: Organic sesame oil is extracted from sesame seeds (Sesamum indicum). The oil is obtained by mechanical pressing without the application of heat (cold pressed).

features: Cold-pressed and additive-free
Rich in vitamin E and natural antioxidants
Multi-purpose for culinary and therapeutic use
Certified organic and sustainably produced

subProducts.name: Coconut Oil
subProducts.description: Our virgin coconut oil is produced from fresh, organically grown coconuts through a gentle cold-press process that maintains its natural coconut aroma, taste, and nutrient profile. Extracted from the dried kernel (copra) at low temperatures of 40–45°C and filtered for purity, it is rich in medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs), lauric acid, and antioxidants. It promotes energy, supports immune health, and nourishes hair and skin. Ideal for low to medium-heat cooking, baking, skincare, and wellness applications.

metrics.Process: The coconut oil is pressed out of the dried kernel flesh(kopra). At a temperature of 40-45 degrees Celsius, filtered, packed

features: 100% virgin and cold-pressed for maximum purity
Rich in MCTs and lauric acid for energy and immune support
Ideal for both culinary and cosmetic applications
Long shelf life and premium organic certification

subProducts.name: Rapeseed oil
subProducts.description: Experience our deodorized rapeseed oil, carefully pressed from the finest rapeseeds. With its high smoke point, it is the secret ingredient for perfectly crisp fries, golden-brown baked goods, and flavourful dressings. This organic rapeseed oil is crafted for both gourmet chefs and industrial innovators alike.

metrics.Process: The rapeseed oil is pressed out of the rapeseed and deodorised. Transported to The Netherlands where it is deodorised and bleached to obtain a neutral oil.

features: 100% virgin and cold-pressed for maximum purity
Rich in MCTs and lauric acid for energy and immune support
Ideal for both culinary and cosmetic applications
Long shelf life and premium organic certification

subProducts.name: Kenya AA Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya AA Coffee represents the highest grade of Arabica beans cultivated in Kenya, grown at elevations between 1,400 and 2,000 meters above sea level on rich volcanic soils. The beans are large, dense, and uniform, with exceptional flavor clarity. AA coffee is globally acclaimed for its full body, bright citrus acidity, and complex aroma featuring notes of black currant, berry, and wine-like undertones. Each lot is carefully hand-picked, fully washed, and sun-dried on raised beds to preserve its unique flavor characteristics. Kenya AA sets the global benchmark for specialty Arabica coffee quality.

specifics.Flavor Profile: Bright acidity, winey notes, full body, fruity aroma

features: Top-grade Arabica with exceptional flavor complexity
Hand-picked and washed using traditional Kenyan process
High-altitude cultivation enhances sweetness and acidity
Globally recognized as a specialty coffee standard

subProducts.name: Kenya AB Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya AB Coffee is a blend of A and B bean grades, slightly smaller than AA but maintaining outstanding quality. It offers a balanced flavor with moderate acidity, medium body, and pronounced sweetness. The cup features fruity and floral notes with a smooth, clean finish. Representing about 40% of Kenya’s coffee exports, the AB grade is favored by international roasters for its consistency, affordability, and versatility in blending and single-origin offerings.

specifics.Flavor Profile: Balanced sweetness, mild acidity, smooth body

features: Excellent balance of flavor and body
Most widely traded Kenyan coffee grade
Ideal for blends and single-origin profiles
Steady export availability

subProducts.name: Kenya PB (Peaberry) Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya PB (Peaberry) Coffee consists of rare, single-seed beans that develop when only one seed forms inside the cherry instead of two. These small, round beans roast evenly and produce a more concentrated, aromatic flavor. Known for their pronounced acidity, full body, and fruit-forward notes of citrus and black currant, Peaberry coffees deliver a bold, clean, and vibrant cup. They represent about 5% of Kenya’s total coffee yield, making them highly prized among specialty roasters.

specifics.Flavor Profile: Citrus brightness, sweet berry notes, full body

features: Rare single-bean formation for concentrated flavor
Vibrant acidity and fruity complexity
Favored in specialty markets worldwide
Limited annual yield (5% of Kenya’s crop)

subProducts.name: Kenya C Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya C Coffee is composed of smaller Arabica beans that retain the same washed processing and vibrant flavor profile as the higher grades. While slightly lighter in body, it maintains pleasant acidity and sweet, nutty undertones. C grade coffees are often used in blends or as affordable single-origin options where consistency and mild flavor are desired. Despite its smaller size, Kenya C coffee upholds the quality and aroma that define Kenyan Arabicas.
features: Smaller beans with consistent flavor
Balanced sweetness and smooth texture
Ideal for blending and soluble coffee applications

subProducts.name: Kenya E (Elephant) Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya E (Elephant) Coffee features exceptionally large beans formed by the natural fusion of two coffee seeds within a single cherry. These rare, oversized beans produce a mild yet full-bodied cup with subtle floral and chocolate undertones. Due to their unique size, they require careful roasting to achieve even heat distribution. Elephant beans are typically roasted for premium niche markets and specialty blends, offering a distinct flavor profile not found in standard grades.
features: Rare oversized 'elephant' beans
Smooth and mild flavor profile
Limited production and export quantity

subProducts.name: Kenya TT Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya TT Coffee consists of smaller, lighter beans separated during the grading process from AA, AB, and PB lots. Despite their size, TT beans retain a pleasant aroma and medium acidity, offering a well-rounded cup. TT grade is commonly used for instant coffee production and commercial blends. It provides a cost-effective alternative while preserving the authentic Kenyan coffee character.
features: Smaller bean size with smooth flavor
Affordable grade retaining Kenyan profile
Ideal for mass-market blends

subProducts.name: Kenya T Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya T Coffee comprises the thinnest and smallest fragments obtained from the milling process. Although it has a lighter body and milder taste, it is valuable for blending and soluble coffee manufacturing. T grade beans undergo the same washing and drying processes as higher grades, maintaining Kenya’s signature brightness and aroma at a lower cost.
features: Fine-grade Arabica particles
Suitable for instant and commercial blends

subProducts.name: Kenya MH/ML (Mbuni) Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenya MH/ML, commonly known as Mbuni coffee, is a naturally processed (unwashed) grade made from cherries dried whole under the sun. It offers a heavy body, rustic flavor, and less acidity compared to washed grades. The cup profile is earthy with notes of dark chocolate and dried fruit. Widely used in espresso blends and instant coffee production, Mbuni represents Kenya’s traditional dry-processing method, especially prevalent in arid growing regions.
features: Naturally processed for full, rustic flavor
Lower acidity and higher body
Traditional dry-processed Kenyan coffee

subProducts.name: Robusta Coffee
subProducts.description: Kenyan Robusta Coffee is grown in lower-altitude regions with tropical climates ideal for high-yield, pest-resistant coffee. Known for its strong flavor, thick crema, and high caffeine content (2–2.7%), Robusta is primarily used in espresso and instant coffee production. Its cup profile features bold earthy, nutty, and cocoa tones, delivering an intense taste and long-lasting finish. Kenyan Robusta meets international standards for industrial and blending applications.
features: High caffeine for strong, full-bodied flavor
Enhances crema in espresso blends
Consistent East African quality supply

subProducts.name: Maize (Corn)
subProducts.description: Our high-grade white and yellow maize is sourced from carefully selected farms across East Africa. Grown in fertile volcanic soils and harvested under optimal conditions, the kernels are fully matured, dried to ideal moisture levels, and thoroughly cleaned to ensure purity and safety. Maize serves as a global dietary staple, used for food production, animal feed, and industrial applications. It is processed into maize flour, grits, starch, and ethanol. With its high starch content and nutritional value, our maize meets both food-grade and feed-grade standards.

desc.Description: White and yellow maize grains for food and industrial use

features: Non-GMO, sun-dried, and naturally processed
Suitable for both food-grade and feed-grade applications
High starch yield and consistent grain size
Complies with regional and international export standards

subProducts.name: Rice (Paddy and Milled)
subProducts.description: Our premium long-grain rice is cultivated in Kenya’s Mwea irrigation zone and other fertile African lowlands. Each grain is carefully harvested, de-husked, and polished to deliver uniform, fragrant rice with a smooth texture. The product includes both paddy (unmilled) and milled varieties suitable for consumption and further processing. With a naturally rich aroma and soft cooking quality, this rice is ideal for households, restaurants, and food industries seeking superior quality. We also supply broken rice and by-products for feed and brewing applications.
features: High-quality long-grain texture and aroma
Low breakage rate and uniform grain size
Processed in certified milling facilities
Suitable for both local and export markets

subProducts.name: Sorghum
subProducts.description: Our high-quality red and white sorghum is cultivated under optimal dryland conditions, ensuring a naturally gluten-free and nutrient-rich grain. Sorghum is valued for its high fiber, protein, and antioxidant content, making it an essential ingredient in health foods, beverages, and livestock feed. It is used in brewing, porridge, flour milling, and ethanol production. The grain’s natural resistance to drought and pests supports sustainable farming and stable supply.
features: Naturally gluten-free and high in dietary fiber
Ideal for breweries and flour processors
Sourced from drought-resistant crops
Sustainably farmed and cleaned for export

subProducts.name: Beans (Mixed Varieties)
subProducts.description: We supply a wide selection of high-quality dry beans including red kidney, black, pinto, navy, and yellow beans. These are naturally sun-dried and sorted to remove impurities. Our beans are rich in protein, fiber, and complex carbohydrates, making them a vital source of plant-based nutrition. They are used in household cooking, canning, and food processing industries across Africa and internationally. Each batch is tested for moisture and aflatoxin to meet export-grade safety standards.

desc.Description: Red kidney, black, pinto, navy, and yellow beans

features: High in plant-based protein and fiber
Multiple varieties available to suit diverse markets

Non-GMO and aflatoxin compliant

subProducts.name: Lentils (Green and Red)
subProducts.description: Our lentils are sourced from high-yield farms that practice sustainable agriculture. We supply both green and red split lentils, cleaned and graded to export specifications. Lentils are known for their quick cooking properties and are a rich source of plant-based protein, iron, and dietary fiber. They are used extensively in soups, stews, curries, and ready-to-eat food production. We offer uniform grain size and moisture-controlled packaging to preserve quality.

features: Naturally high in protein and iron

subProducts.name: Cashew Nuts
subProducts.description: Our premium organic cashew nuts are sourced from coastal East Africa, primarily grown in the tropical regions of Kenya and Tanzania. Each nut is handpicked and processed under stringent hygienic standards, ensuring superior crunch, creamy texture, and authentic natural taste. The nuts are shelled, dried, and graded for size and quality before being vacuum packed to preserve freshness. Cashew nuts are rich in healthy fats, plant protein, magnesium, and antioxidants — making them ideal for snacks, confectionery, nut butters, and culinary applications.

desc.Description: Whole, split, and broken cashew kernels (W240, W320, W450 grades)

subProducts.name: Macadamia Nuts
subProducts.description: Our macadamia nuts are sourced from the fertile highlands of Kenya, where nutrient-rich volcanic soils and optimal climate produce some of the finest nuts in the world. Grown organically and harvested at peak maturity, the nuts are dried, cracked, and sorted into premium grades. Macadamias are valued for their buttery flavor, smooth texture, and high monounsaturated fat content. They are used in luxury snacks, chocolates, nut butters, and cosmetic oils. Our nuts are processed under HACCP-certified facilities, ensuring premium export quality and consistency.
features: Premium Kenyan macadamias with high oil content
Naturally cholesterol-free and rich in monounsaturated fats

subProducts.name: Groundnuts (Peanuts)
subProducts.description: Our organically grown groundnuts (peanuts) are carefully selected, shelled, and graded for uniform size and quality. Sourced from certified smallholder farmers in Kenya, they are rich in protein, healthy fats, and essential minerals. The nuts are available raw, roasted, or blanched, suitable for human consumption and industrial uses such as peanut butter, confectionery, and snacks. Strict moisture control and aflatoxin testing ensure food safety and compliance with international standards.

subProducts.name: Sesame Seeds
subProducts.description: Our natural white and brown sesame seeds are sourced from smallholder farmers in Kenya and Tanzania. These oil-rich seeds are carefully cleaned, graded, and dried to maintain purity and consistent size. Sesame seeds are a vital raw material in bakery products, tahini paste, sesame oil extraction, and snack toppings. Rich in calcium, iron, and antioxidants, they are both a nutritional powerhouse and an industrial essential. We offer both hulled and unhulled varieties, processed in hygienic facilities to international standards.

desc.Description: Natural and hulled sesame seeds (white and brown)

features: High oil content ideal for tahini and sesame oil

subProducts.name: Chia Seeds
subProducts.description: Our premium chia seeds are organically grown and naturally dried, maintaining their exceptional nutritional profile. Packed with omega-3 fatty acids, fiber, and antioxidants, chia seeds are considered a superfood. They are used in cereals, smoothies, baked goods, and health supplements. The seeds are cleaned and graded for export, ensuring purity and uniformity. Due to their excellent water-absorbing capacity, they are popular in vegan and gluten-free recipes as a natural thickening or binding agent.
features: 100% natural and gluten-free superfood

subProducts.name: Black Pepper
subProducts.description: Our premium-grade black pepper is handpicked from mature pepper vines grown organically in East Africa. Known as the 'King of Spices', it delivers a bold, sharp, and aromatic flavor that enhances savory dishes worldwide. The berries are harvested just before ripening, sun-dried, and machine-sorted to ensure uniform grain size and pungency. Black pepper is rich in piperine, essential oils, and antioxidants — offering both culinary and medicinal benefits. It is widely used in seasonings, sauces, marinades, and traditional remedies for digestion and immunity.
features: High piperine content for bold aroma and taste

subProducts.name: Cloves
subProducts.description: Our aromatic cloves are sourced from the coastal regions of Kenya and Zanzibar, known for producing some of the world’s finest spice crops. The dried flower buds of the clove tree are handpicked and sun-cured to retain their rich essential oil content and strong, sweet aroma. Cloves are widely used in cooking, bakery, beverages, and traditional medicine due to their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Their high eugenol content makes them ideal for use in dental, pharmaceutical, and perfumery industries.

desc.Description: Whole and ground dried clove buds

features: High eugenol oil content for intense aroma and flavor

subProducts.name: Cardamom
subProducts.description: Our cardamom pods are hand-harvested from high-altitude tropical farms, offering a sweet, floral, and slightly spicy aroma. Often referred to as the 'Queen of Spices', cardamom is prized in culinary, confectionery, and beverage industries. The pods are carefully dried and sorted to preserve the volatile oils that give their distinct fragrance. Cardamom is rich in antioxidants and has digestive, antimicrobial, and anti-inflammatory benefits. It is a key ingredient in chai tea, baked goods, and spice blends such as garam masala.

desc.Description: Whole green and ground cardamom pods

subProducts.name: Turmeric
subProducts.description: Our bright golden turmeric is organically cultivated and sun-dried to preserve its potent curcumin content. Known for its earthy flavor and health-promoting properties, turmeric is a cornerstone in culinary, cosmetic, and nutraceutical industries. It’s used in curries, beverages, dietary supplements, and as a natural coloring agent. Our turmeric is finely ground and processed under food-safety-certified conditions to maintain purity and vibrancy.
features: High curcumin content (4–5%) for therapeutic quality

subProducts.name: Cinnamon
subProducts.description: Our premium cinnamon is derived from the inner bark of organically cultivated Cinnamomum trees. It has a warm, sweet aroma and flavor that is essential in bakery, confectionery, and beverage applications. Cinnamon is known for its high cinnamaldehyde content, which gives it both its distinctive fragrance and health-promoting qualities. It is available as whole quills or finely ground powder, ideal for culinary and pharmaceutical use.

subProducts.name: Mangoes (Dried & Fresh)
subProducts.description: Our mangoes are harvested from Kenya’s fertile tropical regions and processed into both fresh and dried forms. The dried mango slices retain the fruit’s natural sweetness and tangy flavor, produced using solar and mechanical dehydration techniques that preserve nutrients and color. Fresh mangoes are handpicked at optimal ripeness to ensure juiciness and rich aroma. Rich in vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants, our mangoes are ideal for snacks, juices, desserts, and export-grade retail packaging.
features: Naturally sweet and aromatic tropical fruit

subProducts.name: Avocado (Hass & Fuerte)
subProducts.description: Our premium Hass and Fuerte avocados are grown in Kenya’s highlands under ideal climatic conditions, resulting in rich, creamy, and nutrient-dense fruits. Each avocado is carefully graded, washed, and packed for both domestic and international markets. Kenya’s year-round production ensures consistent supply. Avocados are naturally high in monounsaturated fats, potassium, and vitamins E and K — making them a global favorite for health-conscious consumers.
features: High oil content and creamy texture

subProducts.name: Pineapples
subProducts.description: Our pineapples are grown in the volcanic soils of Kenya’s central and coastal regions, resulting in a juicy, golden-yellow fruit with high sugar content and low acidity. We supply both fresh pineapples and dried pineapple rings for retail and industrial applications. Pineapples are rich in vitamin C, manganese, and bromelain, making them both a flavorful and health-boosting tropical delicacy. The fruits are carefully graded, peeled, and packaged under strict quality control for export.
features: Naturally sweet and aromatic flavor
Ideal for fresh export or drying

subProducts.name: Green Beans (French Beans)
subProducts.description: Our export-grade French beans are grown by smallholder farmers under GlobalG.A.P. certification standards. They are hand-harvested, sorted, and packed for export to European and Middle Eastern markets. The beans are slender, tender, and rich in vitamins A and C. We ensure cold-chain integrity from farm to destination, preserving freshness, flavor, and nutritional value.
features: Crisp texture and uniform green color
GlobalG.A.P.-certified farms

subProducts.name: Chillies
subProducts.description: We supply a range of fresh and dried chillies including Bird’s Eye, Cayenne, and Green Chillies. Cultivated in Kenya’s arid and semi-arid regions, they offer intense heat and strong aroma. Our chillies are carefully sorted, graded, and sun-dried for export. Capsaicin-rich and full of antioxidants, they are used in sauces, spice blends, and processed foods globally.
features: Wide range of heat levels and varieties
High capsaicin and antioxidant content
Sun-dried for enhanced color and flavor
Ideal for industrial and culinary applications

subProducts.name: Urea (46% Nitrogen)
subProducts.description: Our high-quality agricultural-grade Urea (46% N) is a highly concentrated nitrogen fertilizer used worldwide for crop nutrition and soil enrichment. It is produced from ammonia and carbon dioxide through a precision-controlled synthesis process that ensures maximum purity and granule uniformity. Urea contains 46% nitrogen, the highest nitrogen content among solid fertilizers, making it cost-effective and efficient in delivering essential nutrients to plants. It is suitable for all soil types and a wide variety of crops, including cereals, maize, rice, sugarcane, and horticultural plants. Urea can be used directly on soil or dissolved in water for foliar application. Its versatility extends to industrial applications, including melamine, resin, and adhesive manufacturing. Each batch undergoes strict quality control to ensure low moisture, high biuret stability, and consistent granule size for even distribution in the field.
applications: Crop fertilization (cereals, maize, rice, sugarcane, vegetables)

specifics.Handling Precautions: Store in dry, well-ventilated conditions away from moisture and direct sunlight.

features: Contains the highest nitrogen concentration among solid fertilizers (46%)
Fast-acting nitrogen release supporting vigorous plant growth
Compatible with all crops and soil types
Uniform granule size ensures even spreading and minimal caking
Also suitable for industrial and feed applications

subProducts.name: Raw Hides and Skins
subProducts.description: Our raw hides and skins are carefully sourced from healthy livestock across East Africa, primarily cattle, goats, and sheep reared under natural grazing conditions. The raw hides are freshly flayed, properly cured with natural salt, and preserved under hygienic conditions to maintain their natural strength, fiber density, and texture. We ensure that only defect-free hides, free from putrefaction, holes, and flay cuts, are selected for export. The raw hides and skins serve as premium raw materials for the global leather industry, suitable for processing into full-grain, corrected-grain, and split leather varieties used in footwear, upholstery, and fashion leather goods.

desc.Description: Fresh raw hides and skins, salted and graded for export

features: Sourced from traceable East African livestock
Defect-free and properly preserved hides for tanning
High tensile strength and uniform fiber structure
Ideal for multiple leather grades and end-uses

subProducts.name: Wet Blue Hides
subProducts.description: Our Wet Blue hides are semi-processed bovine and ovine hides tanned using high-grade chromium salts to preserve the collagen structure and prevent putrefaction. This tanning process stabilizes the protein fibers, resulting in flexible, durable hides with a characteristic blue coloration. Wet Blue hides are the global standard intermediate material in the leather value chain, ready for further processing into finished leather for upholstery, footwear, automotive interiors, and luxury leather goods. Each hide is tanned in compliance with international REACH and environmental standards, ensuring consistent quality, low chrome VI content, and eco-friendly processing.

desc.Description: Wet-blue tanned hides, Grade A export standard

packaging: Palletized bundles wrapped in plastic film

specifics.Storage: Cool and aerated storage, avoid sunlight

features: Internationally standardized Wet Blue (chrome-tanned) hides
Compliant with REACH and international leather export norms
Excellent tensile strength and flexibility
Ideal intermediate for high-end leather manufacturing
